poem:
Title: "The Theatre of Folly"

In the vicious arena, bold words war,
Speak of courage, or madness pure?
Kennedy, a gladiator, swears to feast on fear,
Five more brain worms, yet no tear.

Trump and Biden, you're mere echoes in the fray,
His voice is thunderous in the unsettling play.
Yet 'tis but trumpery, a pageant grotesque,
Fueling fires of unrest, a political burlesque.
